intro: Gochnatia maisiana var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically showy inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish to orange flowers arranged in compact clusters. It is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
